videos.name: DIY NECKLACE HEADBANDS
videos.description:
DIY Necklace Headbands 

What You Need: 
Necklaces or Belts | 
Scissors | 
Clear Nail Polish | 
Ruler | 
Pliers | 
Needle and Thread 

For an easy how-to on these DIY Necklace Headbands check out my BLOG http://www.foreveryoursbeauty.com/DIY...

Thanks for watching ! Please send me pictures on my Facebook or Twiter if you ever create your own DIY Necklace Headbands or re-create any of my other tutorials :D I would love to see xoxo Talk to you all very soon !

videos.name: The Messy Side Braid
videos.description: This is a how to tutorial of the Messy Side Braid. This is a bit different then the regular three strand braid. Instead, we first braid the middle strand and mess it up for more volume. Then begin regularly braiding with the three strands, using the middle braid as the middle strand. Tie off the braid with an elastic and mess it up for even more volume. Hope you like it ! Thanks for watching and don't forget to subscribe to my channel :)

videos.name: DIY Chain Head Bands
videos.description: This is a DIY (Do It Yourself) hair tutorial. I show you how to create a fun and creative chain hair band. I saw a beautiful picture on pinterest of a girl with blonde hair sporting this lovely hair accessory. After finally figuring out how to make one myself, I thought it would be fun to share it with you ! As always, let me know any requests you have for new videos in the comment section below. This video took a super long time to create, film, and edit ! Please like the video for more DIY :) ! Thanks so much for watching :)

videos.name: Romantic Ringlet Curls Hair Style
videos.description: This look was actually requested by you guys ! I wore my hair just like this in my recent video called Back to School Makeup Look. I got so many sweet comments asking me to redo it as a tutorial- so here we go :) ! First off, if you have curly hair- perfect ! You can skip the curling hair part. If you have wavy/straight hair, I totally suggest using the conair infiniti clipless curling wand that I used. I would highly recommend investing in it (about $30 from walmart/target/beautystores). I bought mine about a year ago and use it all the time. It turns straight hair into super curly ringlets. And I use it on my naturally curly hair too when I need a little more spring/bounce.

videos.name: No Heat Curls Hair Tutorial for All Hair Types
videos.description: Hello again my lovely friends ! I am happy to say that as of tomarrow I will get back into recording videos more frequently. So look forward to lots of new videos from me ! As always, you can

my Facebook Page to send me inspirational pictures or requests for new videos. I hope you all enjoy this no heat hair tutorial for all hair types. If you weren't able to completely follow, I will be posting on my blog shortly a nice instructional for you to reference to ! Thanks again for watching :) Love you guys. Thanks for staying strong and positive !

videos.name: Taylor Swift Hair Tutorial (Curly Hair)
videos.description:
Sorry for the brightness ! I recorded in the afternoon and it was super sunny that day lol Hope you guys don't mind and still enjoy it :) If you decide to give it a try I would love to see pictures, send them to me on my Twitter or Facebook ! My DIY Sea Salt Spray video will be up soon, I promise!

Heat Tools:

Thanks for watching !

videos.name: DIY Sea Salt Spray for Beachy Waves and Curls
videos.description:
Hey guys !! In this video I show you how I like to make my DIY sea salt spray. I love using this in the summer especially because it has such a wonderful coconut scent ! If you have naturally curly hair like me, you will have beachy curls as the end result. If you have naturally straight or wavy hair you should have nice beachy waves after using a spray like this ! Try it out and let me know how it works for you! :) Good luck !

Products Used:
 >> Sea Salt, Cocounut Oil & Bottle from Target
 >> DevaCurl Hair Gel from a salon

videos.name: DIY Holiday Headband + Voluminous Curls with Bouffant Half Up Hairstyle
videos.description: Hey guys! I'm so excited to share one of many Holiday Hair Tutorials that I have planned for this season =) I was really inspired by the 60s with this look: Big voluminous curls, a bouffant/poof, and an easy DIY Holiday Headband! A big thanks to TRESemme who chose this hairstyle to be in their Throwback Thursdays Series! Join us on Instagram by recreating this hairstyle on yourself and using the hashtag #TRESthrowback and #TBT Thanks for watching love you guys! Xoxo
